Detailed Description

SysSocket class represents adaptation layer to BSD style socket systems. SysSocket is an Apoxi Socket internal class and must not be used by application layer. This class abstracts BSD style socket interfaces. BSD ist not an official supported system socket type.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* SysSocket::LwipPppConnSetupDone)(int error)
 

Type of callback function to use on lwIP PPP setup. This typedef has to be public, otherwise the compiler reports an error that it is inaccessible.

BOOLEAN SysSocket::SetBlocking (  BOOLEAN  blocking = TRUE  ) 
 

Sets the socket to either blocking or non-blocking. TRUE is returned if the desired mode could be set or was already set. The socket has to be open when this method is called.

BOOLEAN SysSocket::SetBlocking (  BOOLEAN  blocking = TRUE  ) 
 

Sets the socket to either blocking or non-blocking. TRUE is returned if the desired mode could be set or was already set. The socket has to be open when this method is called.
